description: Facts and certain transport-related documents about the London Borough of Havering

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["We partner with Havering to implement the Mayor's Transport Strategy in the borough."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP)"}

The LIP is produced by the London Borough of Havering and agreed with us. It sets out the details on transport infrastructure changes in a three-year period to support the Mayor's Transport Strategy .

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) allocation 2019/20","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/havering-2019-20-lip-allocation-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 221KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2017/18 - Borough Leader","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/1718-lip-confirmation-leader-letter-havering.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 71KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2016/17","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/lip-funding-confirmation-letters-16-17-havering.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 75KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) delivery plan letter","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/harrow-lip-delivery-plan-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 72KB","image":{}},{"title":"Public Transport Access Levels - Havering","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/public-transport-access-levels-havering.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 1.97MB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Find out more about LIP funding.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"LIP targets for Havering"}
Each borough has set targets in their LIP against the Mayor's Transport Strategy outcomes - we track and report on progress against these targets in the LIP3 MTS outcomes borough data pack .
For example, the car ownership in the borough was 124,686 in 2017. The LIP target to reduce car ownership by 2041 is 97,400.
Residents in Havering made an average of 474,000 trips each day between 2015 and 2018 by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Car and motorcycle: 55%","Tube/DLR: 3%","National Rail and London Overground: 10%","Bus/Tram: 10%","Taxi/Other: 1%","Cycle: 1%","Walking: 20%"]}
We also work with boroughs to encourage more cycling . We recorded 5,707 daily cycle trips on average starting in Havering between 2015 and 2018.
More resident and visitor population figures are on the GLA website.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Funding for your borough"}
We provide funding to boroughs and local communities for transport improvements in your local area.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Vision Zero"}

We are working with boroughs to reduce the number of deaths and serious injuries from all road collisions to zero by 2041. They are responsible for enforcing safe speeds on their roads, as well as leading community programmes to encourage using roads safely. Find out more about Vision Zero .
In 2017 there were 72 individuals killed or seriously injured in Havering. Our target for 2022 is to reduce this number to 44.
Find out more about collisions in your borough.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What we're working on in Havering"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["We consult local communities on a range of projects every year - \u003ca href=\"https://consultations.tfl.gov.uk/consultation_finder/?advanced=1\u0026st=open\"\u003esearch on the TfL Consultation Hub\u003c/a\u003e ","Find out about \u003ca href=\"/status-updates/major-works-and-events\"\u003emajor works and events near you\u003c/a\u003e ","See some ongoing TfL \u003ca href=\"http://www.tfl.gov.uk/travel-information/improvements-and-projects/?Borough=Havering\"\u003eimprovements and projects in or near Havering\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Work now going on in your borough includes:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003eBeam Parkway\u003c/strong\u003e - working with the borough, we're part funding a scheme that includes new segregated cycle lanes, more crossing points and improved public spaces along the A1306 New Road in Rainham. This will support the new Beam Park rail station and recently approved housing zone","\u003cstrong\u003eRomford town centre\u003c/strong\u003e - we're investing £5.7m as part of \u003ca href=\"/info-for/boroughs/liveable-neighbourhoods\"\u003eLiveable Neighbourhoods\u003c/a\u003e to help the council make the busy ring road easier to cross. Existing subways will be replaced by pedestrian and cycle crossings at street level, and a new bus lane and public spaces added","\u003cstrong\u003eA12 Gubbins Lane\u003c/strong\u003e - we're developing a scheme with the borough to improve pedestrian and cycling crossings"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Bus network changes"}
From time to time - after consulting the public - we alter bus routes to reflect changing patterns in demand. We also make temporary changes, often because of road works. See the latest bus changes.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Our assets in Havering"}
Assets we maintain in your borough include:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Four Tube stations","Three Elizabeth line stations","Three London Overground stations","Around 870 bus stops - \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/maps_/bus-spider-maps?Query=Havering\"\u003esee all 36 day bus routes in Havering\u003c/a\u003e ","Around 145 traffic signals","Over 21 kilometres of \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/modes/driving/red-routes/red-route-maps\"\u003ered routes\u003c/a\u003e "]}
See a map of our assets in London.
We maintain our assets until they need to be renewed or disposed of as set out in our asset management plan. We do this by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Servicing them regularly to keep them operational","Repairing or replacing faulty assets"]}
Report a problem on a London street with our Streetcare tool .
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"We do not maintain in Havering:"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Non-red route roads - these roads are maintained by \u003ca href=\"https://www.havering.gov.uk/\"\u003eHavering\u003c/a\u003e ","Litter removal on red routes - this is also the borough's responsibility","Network Rail track at London Overground stations - \u003ca href=\"https://www.networkrail.co.uk/communities/contact-us/\"\u003econtact Network Rail\u003c/a\u003e ","Taxis and mini cabs - these are owned by \u003ca href=\"/modes/taxis-and-minicabs/what-to-expect-from-your-journey\"\u003etaxi drivers and minicab offices \u003c/a\u003e ","Two bus garages in Havering that are \u003ca href=\"/modes/buses/who-runs-your-bus\"\u003eowned and managed by bus companies\u003c/a\u003e ","Coaches"," \u003ca href=\"/info-for/taxis-and-private-hire/taxi-ranks\"\u003eTaxi ranks\u003c/a\u003e on borough roads. Cars and other vehicles parked on taxi ranks can be \u003ca href=\"https://www.havering.gov.uk/info/20004/parking\"\u003ereported to Havering\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Report private hire vehicles (PHVs) parked on ranks or unattended taxis on ranks directly to us.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Dealing with severe weather"}
For documents relating to winter service in the boroughs, go to the Streets publications page .
